intro: Crataegus stankovii, commonly known as the Stanković hawthorn, is a species of flowering plant in the rose family, Rosaceae. It is native to the Balkan region, particularly found in parts of Serbia and Bosnia and Herzegovina. This shrub typically grows in forested areas and is characterized by its thorny stems and clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are edible but often used more for ornamental purposes. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
